Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I have created a STAKEDTROLL chain, it uses its own branch of komodo and will be our first chain, that is not in the cluster. It is ondemand blocks, with a static difficulty of 1 and a block reward of 0.  I will disable the RPC call for `getblocktemplate` so that it will not be easy to GPU/ASIC mine.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also ther is 1,000,000,000 coins in the faucet and ir rewards 100 coins. This is the only way to get coins.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This has taken way longer than it should have, but I think I finally got this working.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Our first chain that needs a diffrent branch is done.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To make it so that it has only ondemand blocks with a static difficulty of 1, i have forced ac_pubkey and ac_perc, so that stratums dont work, but the block reward and the ac_perc reward are both 0. The entire coin supply is in the faucet apart from 100 coins i sent to each notary address.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But there is nothing stopping anyone creating a new address and then doing a faucetget to get 100 coins.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: KV chat is also working to stdout

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but we might need a few scripts to handle that a bit easier.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: got a few more things to double check and clean up then i will update assetchains.json and test on my nodes. Then we can update

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
The reason james never added any stops to existing block-on-demand (as far as a tx requirement goes) is because the miner can always create a tx
Now as far as doing it for 0 br, I agree that no one will do it for long (other than to show that they can) without any personal gains

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: My sticking point earlier was that you said 'even if we have a block reward set'; If there is a br, then the personal gain changes in the favor of choosing to mine if the cost of mining < total br that can be had

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, I realised later that if there was a block reward then someone would e determined enough to make it work. I cannot think of any other way to do it  than the way I have done. It is muhc better then there being no checks. This seems the only possible way to creat a chain with as close to instant TX confirm as possible, that also wouldnt be just blown up by an attacker.
